Job Description

The role of the Director-level Transaction Manager is to negotiate term sheets and all transaction-related documents for real estate financing products, identify and assess risks associated with proposed financings, develop structures to mitigate such risks, manage outside legal counsel in their responsibilities, and to collaborate with origination, underwriting, capital markets, asset management and the risk and legal departments in originating, distributing and managing all financing vehicles undertaken by the RE&H group for the Americas platform at Natixis.

The salary range for this position will be between $190,000 - $250,000. Natixis is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Actual base salary will vary and will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, education, skills set, applicable licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Base salary is only one component of our total rewards package. Natixis also offers a generous benefits package, and you may be eligible for a discretionary incentive award depending on company and individual performance.

He/she/they will:
• Take primary role in negotiating term sheets and all transactional documents (loan agreements, co-lender/intercreditor agreements, etc.).
• Manage outside counsel on transactions.
• Assess deal risks and evaluate due diligence issues, together with origination, underwriting and capital markets teams.
• Advise Head of Transaction Management and other team members on deal risks; propose structures to mitigate such risks.
• Coordinate with legal department on financings.
• Work with asset management team to manage closed facilities.
• Collaborate with team members and other Natixis departments in the origination, distribution and management of all RE&H financing vehicles.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience

• J.D. from accredited institution
• Admission to New York bar
• 3+ years of private law firm practice representing institutions in commercial real estate lending OR as a Real Estate Transaction Manager in a Corporate & Investment Bank.
• Effective written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
• Possess a solid foundation in commercial real estate diligence and loan document drafting and negotiation.
• Ability to work effectively in a dynamic team environment.
• Ability to effectively handle a fast-paced environment and successfully meet established deadline requirements.
• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.
